wikipedia_page.main: Joanna Constantinidis née Connell, (12 December 1927 – 1 August 2000) was an English potter and ceramic artist.

response: Lotherton Hall houses a small collection of modern craft studio pottery, including works by significant potters such as Alison Britton, Michael Cardew, Michael Casson, Joanna Constantinidis, Hans Coper, Elizabeth Fritsch, T.S. Haile, Bernard Leach, Janet Leach, Lucy Rie and Sutton Taylor.Wells-Cole, A. 1980. Fifty years of new ceramics in Leeds. Leeds Arts Calendar, No.87, pp.21–30. https://leedsartfund.org/files/calendar/No%20-%20%2087%201980.pdf. Retrieved 9 July 2020.
*Joanna Constantinidis, 72, English potter and ceramic artist.
